title: TC001-Create a new order from the order list and verify it appears in the list
description: Verifies a user can start from the dashboard, create a new order, save it, and then see it listed.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:3000
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Fill the email and password fields with provided credentials and click the 'ENTRAR' (login) button to sign in.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[1]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('cristalbrindes@cristalbrindes.com.br')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('@SucessoCristal09!')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Novo Pedido' (New Order) button to open the new order page (expected route: /pedido/novo).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[1]/div[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Open the 'Client' dropdown/input so the client 'Cliente Teste E2E' can be entered/selected.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[2]/div[1]/section[2]/div[2]/div[1]/div/div').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Novo Pedido' button on the dashboard to (re)open the new order page, then locate the Client input.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[1]/div[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Open the 'Client' dropdown by clicking the client select element (use index 2047) so the client 'Cliente Teste E2E' can be entered/selected.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[2]/div[1]/section[2]/div[2]/div[1]/div/div').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[1]/div/div[2]/form/div[3]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('(11) 91234-5678')
        
        # -> Click the 'Novo Pedido' button to (re)open the new order page so the client modal can be completed and the order saved (click element index 2932).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[1]/div[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Open the Client select so 'Cliente Teste E2E' can be entered/created (click the Nome / Razão Social select).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[2]/div[1]/section[2]/div[2]/div[1]/div/div').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Novo Pedido' button (index 4046) to open the new order page so the client creation modal can be completed.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[1]/div[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Open the Client select (Nome / Razão Social) to start adding/selecting 'Cliente Teste E2E'.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[2]/div[1]/section[2]/div[2]/div[1]/div/div').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Open the client creation flow by clicking 'Adicionar Novo' in the client select (click element index 5025).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[2]/div[1]/section[2]/div[2]/div[1]/div/div[2]/div[2]/div[5]/span').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Novo Pedido' button (index 5182) to open the new order page (/pedido/novo) and continue the client creation flow.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[1]/div[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Fill the missing client E-mail in the client modal (input index 5501) and then finalize the order by clicking 'FINALIZAR ABERTURA' (button index 5396).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[2]/div[1]/section[2]/div[2]/div[4]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('cliente.teste.e2e@example.com')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[1]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Open the orders list (click 'Pedidos') and verify the newly created order for 'Cliente Teste E2E' appears in the listing.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/header/div/div/div[1]/nav/div[3]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Open the orders list (Pedidos) to refresh the listing and search the page for the text 'Cliente Teste E2E' to verify the newly created order is present.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/header/div/div/div[1]/nav/div[3]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Filter the orders list using the search input by entering 'Cliente Teste E2E' and submitting the search to verify whether the newly created order appears.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Cliente Teste E2E')
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Cliente Teste E2E').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Expected the newly created order for 'Cliente Teste E2E' to appear in the orders list after creating and saving it, but the entry was not found.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
Test result: FAILED to verify listing. Summary:
- Goal: Verify user can start at dashboard, create a new order, save it, and see it listed.
- Steps completed (7/8): Navigate to /login; enter email; enter password; click Login; verify dashboard loaded; click Novo Pedido and create order (client created and FINALIZAR ABERTURA clicked).
- Remaining verification: Confirm the new order for 'Cliente Teste E2E' appears in the orders list.
- Outcome: Verification failed — the string 'Cliente Teste E2E' was NOT FOUND in the orders list after searching and scanning the orders page.
- Key interactions: Client created with Nome='Cliente Teste E2E', CNPJ='12.345.678/0001-95', Telefone='(11) 91234-5678', E-mail='cliente.teste.e2e@example.com'; FINALIZAR ABERTURA clicked.
- Failures observed: multiple stale/non-interactable element click attempts (indexes 937, 3244, 5025) and one failed orders-list click (index 5143). Search for the client returned NOT FOUND.
- Recommendations: 1) Retry refreshing the orders list (full page reload) and re-run the search; 2) Check backend/API that lists orders to confirm the order was created server-side; 3) If the order exists server-side but is not shown, investigate caching/filters/status (the new order may have a different status/filter applied).
Conclusion: The flow to create and submit the order completed, but the final verification that the order appears in the orders list failed. Test marked as unsuccessful (success=false).

import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments

            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers

                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode

        )

import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():

    context = None

            headless=True,
            args=[

                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:

                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow

        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Type 'zzzzzz-no-results' into the budgets search/filter field (input index 567) and wait briefly for results to update.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('zzzzzz-no-results')
        
        # -> Clear the budgets search/filter field to remove 'zzzzzz-no-results', wait for results to update, then verify that the budgets list contains rows (look for 'PED-2026-001' or 'Mostrando' text).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/main/div/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('')
        
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

Summary of test attempt and results:

What was attempted:
- Logged in with provided credentials and reached the dashboard.
- Navigated to Cadastros -> Adicionar Novo -> CLIENTE form.
- Entered Name = 'Parceiro Doc Invalido' and Document (CNPJ/CPF) = '111.111.111-11'.
- Clicked SALVAR CADASTRO twice to trigger validation.

What happened:
- Both Save attempts failed: the Save button was not interactable / the element became stale before the click could be performed. No 'Invalid CPF/CNPJ' validation message appeared in any attempt.
- The page is currently showing the Cadastros list (Novo Cadastro form is not open in the current DOM snapshot), and interactive elements for Cadastros are available.

Conclusion:
- The test to verify that the system blocks saving invalid CPF/CNPJ and shows 'Invalid CPF/CNPJ' could not be completed because the Save action could not be executed (2 failed attempts). Therefore it is not possible to confirm the validation message from this automated run.

Recommendations / next steps (pick one):
1) Retry with alternative methods: reload the app, increase wait time before clicking Save, or attempt Save via keyboard (Enter) — needs permission to continue. 
2) Report a website issue to the development team: "Save button not interactable on CLIENTE form; prevents validation checks; intermittent SPA re-rendering/stale element indexes" — attach these logs/screenshots. 
3) Perform a manual check (user opens the app in a browser and tries the steps) and report the observed behavior.

Please indicate which next action is preferred (retry with alternatives, escalate to devs, or manual verification). Automation stopped because Save was attempted twice and both attempts failed (per test rules).

title: TC039-Cancel creating a partner does not add it to the list

code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:3000
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

async def run_test():
    pw = None

    try:

        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode

        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
